kind: Deployment

    app: microservices
    tier: app
  name: app-tier
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 5
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      tier: app

      labels:
        app: microservices
        tier: app

      containers:

        - name: REDIS_URL
          value: redis://$(DATA_TIER_SERVICE_HOST):$(DATA_TIER_SERVICE_PORT_REDIS)
        image: lrakai/microservices:server-v1
        name: server
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8080
        resources:
          requests:
            cpu: 20m

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to keel/Deployment/keel:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: keel
  name: keel
  namespace: keel
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: keel
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: keel
    spec:
      containers:
      - command:
        - /bin/keel
        env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        - name: PROJECT_ID
          value: "0"
        - name: PUBSUB
          value: ""
        - name: BASIC_AUTH_USER
          value: adminadam
        - name: BASIC_AUTH_PASSWORD
          value: SECRET_STORED_IN_SECRET_MANAGER
        - name: AUTHENTICATED_WEBHOOKS
          value: "false"
        - name: AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
          value: ""
        - name: AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
          value: ""
        - name: AWS_REGION
          value: ""
        - name: WEBHOOK_ENDPOINT
          value: ""
        - name: MATTERMOST_ENDPOINT
          value: ""
        - name: TEAMS_WEBHOOK_URL
          value: ""
        - name: SLACK_TOKEN
          value: ""
        - name: SLACK_CHANNELS
          value: general
        - name: SLACK_APPROVALS_CHANNEL
          value: general
        - name: SLACK_BOT_NAME
          value: keel
        - name: HIPCHAT_TOKEN
          value: ""
        - name: HIPCHAT_CHANNELS
          value: ""
        - name: HIPCHAT_APPROVALS_CHANNEL
          value: ""
        - name: HIPCHAT_APPROVALS_BOT_NAME
          value: ""
        - name: HIPCHAT_APPROVALS_USER_NAME
          value: ""
        - name: HIPCHAT_APPROVALS_PASSWORT
          value: ""
        - name: NOTIFICATION_LEVEL
          value: info
        - name: INSECURE_REGISTRY
          value: "true"
        image: keelhq/keel:latest
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        livenessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /healthz
            port: 9300
          initialDelaySeconds: 30
          timeoutSeconds: 10
        name: keel
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9300
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 128Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 50m
            memory: 64Mi
      serviceAccountName: keel

---

    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-version: v1
  name: allow-dns
  namespace: keel
spec:
  egress:
  - ports:
    - port: 53
      protocol: UDP
    to:
    - namespaceSelector:
        matchLabels:
          name: kube-system
  podSelector:
    matchLabels: {}
  policyTypes:
  - Egress

---

##### FILE: 6-deployment.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/Deployment/metrics-server:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    k8s-app: metrics-server
  name: metrics-server
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: metrics-server
  strategy:
    rollingUpdate:
      maxUnavailable: 0
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
      labels:
        k8s-app: metrics-server
    spec:
      containers:
      - args:
        - --cert-dir=/tmp
        - --secure-port=443
        - --kubelet-preferred-address-types=InternalIP,ExternalIP,Hostname
        - --kubelet-use-node-status-port
        - --metric-resolution=15s
        image: k8s.gcr.io/metrics-server/metrics-server:v0.5.0
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        livenessProbe:
          failureThreshold: 3
          httpGet:
            path: /livez
            port: https
            scheme: HTTPS
          periodSeconds: 10
        name: metrics-server
        ports:
        - containerPort: 443
          name: https
          protocol: TCP
        readinessProbe:
          failureThreshold: 3
          httpGet:
            path: /readyz
            port: https
            scheme: HTTPS
          initialDelaySeconds: 20
          periodSeconds: 10
        resources:
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 200Mi
        securityContext:
          readOnlyRootFilesystem: true
          runAsNonRoot: true
          runAsUser: 1000
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /tmp
          name: tmp-dir
      nodeSelector:
        kubernetes.io/os: linux
      priorityClassName: system-cluster-critical
      serviceAccountName: metrics-server
      volumes:
      - emptyDir: {}
        name: tmp-dir

---

##### FILE: 6-deployment1.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to grafana/Deployment/grafana:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: grafana
  namespace: grafana
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: grafana
  strategy:
    type: Recreate
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: grafana
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_USER
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: admin-user
              name: grafana
        - name: GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_PASSWORD
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: admin-password
              name: grafana
        image: grafana/grafana:9.2.4
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        livenessProbe:
          failureThreshold: 10
          httpGet:
            path: /api/health
            port: 3000
          initialDelaySeconds: 60
          timeoutSeconds: 30
        name: grafana
        ports:
        - containerPort: 3000
          name: grafana
          protocol: TCP
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /api/health
            port: 3000
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 2000m
            memory: 4Gi
          requests:
            cpu: 500m
            memory: 1Gi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /var/lib/grafana
          name: storage
        - mountPath: /etc/grafana/grafana.ini
          name: config
          subPath: grafana.ini
        - mountPath: /etc/grafana/provisioning/datasources/datasources.yaml
          name: datasources
          subPath: datasources.yaml
        - mountPath: /etc/grafana/provisioning/dashboards/dashboardproviders.yaml
          name: dashboards
          subPath: dashboardproviders.yaml
        - mountPath: /var/lib/grafana/dashboards/kubernetes/volumes.json
          name: volumes-dashboard
          subPath: volumes.json
      securityContext:
        fsGroup: 472
        runAsUser: 472
      volumes:
      - name: storage
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: grafana
      - configMap:
          name: grafana
        name: config
      - configMap:
          name: datasources
        name: datasources
      - configMap:
          name: dashboards
        name: dashboards
      - configMap:
          name: volumes-dashboard
        name: volumes-dashboard

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to grafana/Deployment/grafana:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: grafana
  namespace: grafana
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: grafana
  strategy:
    type: Recreate
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: grafana
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_USER
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: admin-user
              name: grafana
        - name: GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_PASSWORD
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: admin-password
              name: grafana
        image: grafana/grafana:9.2.4
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        livenessProbe:
          failureThreshold: 10
          httpGet:
            path: /api/health
            port: 3000
          initialDelaySeconds: 60
          timeoutSeconds: 30
        name: grafana
        ports:
        - containerPort: 3000
          name: grafana
          protocol: TCP
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /api/health
            port: 3000
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 2000m
            memory: 4Gi
          requests:
            cpu: 500m
            memory: 1Gi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /var/lib/grafana
          name: storage
        - mountPath: /etc/grafana/grafana.ini
          name: config
          subPath: grafana.ini
        - mountPath: /etc/grafana/provisioning/datasources/datasources.yaml
          name: datasources
          subPath: datasources.yaml
        - mountPath: /etc/grafana/provisioning/dashboards/dashboardproviders.yaml
          name: dashboards
          subPath: dashboardproviders.yaml
        - mountPath: /var/lib/grafana/dashboards/kubernetes/volumes.json
          name: volumes-dashboard
          subPath: volumes.json
      securityContext:
        fsGroup: 472
        runAsUser: 472
      volumes:
      - name: storage
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: grafana
      - configMap:
          name: grafana
        name: config
      - configMap:
          name: datasources
        name: datasources
      - configMap:
          name: dashboards
        name: dashboards
      - configMap:
          name: volumes-dashboard
        name: volumes-dashboard

          name: datasources
          subPath: datasources.yaml
        - mountPath: /etc/grafana/provisioning/dashboards/dashboardproviders.yaml
          name: dashboards
          subPath: dashboardproviders.yaml
      securityContext:
        fsGroup: 472
        runAsUser: 472
      volumes:
      - name: storage
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: grafana
      - configMap:
          name: grafana
        name: config
      - configMap:
          name: datasources
        name: datasources
      - configMap:
          name: dashboards
        name: dashboards

    type: Recreate

        app: grafana

      - env:
        - name: GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_USER

              key: admin-user

        - name: GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_PASSWORD
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: admin-password
              name: grafana
        image: grafana/grafana:9.4.1
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        livenessProbe:
          failureThreshold: 10
          httpGet:
            path: /api/health
            port: 3000
          initialDelaySeconds: 60
          timeoutSeconds: 30
        name: grafana
        ports:
        - containerPort: 3000
          name: grafana
          protocol: TCP
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /api/health
            port: 3000
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 2000m
            memory: 4Gi
          requests:
            cpu: 500m
            memory: 1Gi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /etc/grafana/grafana.ini
          name: config
          subPath: grafana.ini
        - mountPath: /etc/grafana/provisioning/datasources/datasources.yaml
          name: datasources
          subPath: datasources.yaml
        - mountPath: /etc/grafana/provisioning/dashboards/dashboardproviders.yaml
          name: dashboards
          subPath: dashboardproviders.yaml
      securityContext:
        fsGroup: 472
        runAsUser: 472
      volumes:
      - configMap:
          name: grafana
        name: config
      - configMap:
          name: datasources
        name: datasources
      - configMap:
          name: dashboards
        name: dashboards

##### FILE: 6-deployment18.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/nginx:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: nginx
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: nginx
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: nginx
    spec:
      affinity:
        nodeAffinity:
          preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution:
          - preference:
              matchExpressions:
              - key: disktype
                operator: In
                values:
                - ssd
            weight: 1
          - preference:
              matchExpressions:
              - key: price
                operator: In
                values:
                - spot
            weight: 50
      containers:
      - image: nginx:1.14.2
        name: nginx
        ports:
        - containerPort: 80
        resources:
          requests:
            cpu: "1"
            memory: 2Gi

---

##### FILE: 6-deployment19.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to grafana/Deployment/grafana:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: grafana
  namespace: grafana
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: grafana
  strategy:
    type: Recreate
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: grafana
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_USER
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: admin-user
              name: grafana
        - name: GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_PASSWORD
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: admin-password
              name: grafana
        image: grafana/grafana:9.2.4
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        livenessProbe:
          failureThreshold: 10
          httpGet:
            path: /api/health
            port: 3000
          initialDelaySeconds: 60
          timeoutSeconds: 30
        name: grafana
        ports:
        - containerPort: 3000
          name: grafana
          protocol: TCP
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /api/health
            port: 3000
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 2000m
            memory: 4Gi
          requests:
            cpu: 500m
            memory: 1Gi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /var/lib/grafana
          name: storage
        - mountPath: /etc/grafana/grafana.ini
          name: config
          subPath: grafana.ini
        - mountPath: /etc/grafana/provisioning/datasources/datasources.yaml
          name: datasources
          subPath: datasources.yaml
        - mountPath: /etc/grafana/provisioning/dashboards/dashboardproviders.yaml
          name: dashboards
          subPath: dashboardproviders.yaml
        - mountPath: /var/lib/grafana/dashboards/kubernetes/volumes.json
          name: volumes-dashboard
          subPath: volumes.json
      securityContext:
        fsGroup: 472
        runAsUser: 472
      volumes:
      - name: storage
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: grafana
      - configMap:
          name: grafana
        name: config
      - configMap:
          name: datasources
        name: datasources
      - configMap:
          name: dashboards
        name: dashboards
      - configMap:
          name: volumes-dashboard
        name: volumes-dashboard

##### FILE: 6-deployment6.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to grafana/Deployment/grafana:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: grafana
  namespace: grafana
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: grafana
  strategy:
    type: Recreate
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: grafana
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_USER
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: admin-user
              name: grafana
        - name: GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_PASSWORD
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: admin-password
              name: grafana
        image: grafana/grafana:9.3.2
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        livenessProbe:
          failureThreshold: 10
          httpGet:
            path: /api/health
            port: 3000
          initialDelaySeconds: 60
          timeoutSeconds: 30
        name: grafana
        ports:
        - containerPort: 3000
          name: grafana
          protocol: TCP
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /api/health
            port: 3000
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 2000m
            memory: 4Gi
          requests:
            cpu: 500m
            memory: 1Gi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /var/lib/grafana
          name: storage
        - mountPath: /etc/grafana/grafana.ini
          name: config
          subPath: grafana.ini
        - mountPath: /etc/grafana/provisioning/datasources/datasources.yaml
          name: datasources
          subPath: datasources.yaml
        - mountPath: /etc/grafana/provisioning/dashboards/dashboardproviders.yaml
          name: dashboards
          subPath: dashboardproviders.yaml
      securityContext:
        fsGroup: 472
        runAsUser: 472
      volumes:
      - name: storage
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: grafana
      - configMap:
          name: grafana
        name: config
      - configMap:
          name: datasources
        name: datasources
      - configMap:
          name: dashboards
        name: dashboards

---

apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: grafana
  namespace: grafana
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: grafana
  strategy:
    type: Recreate
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: grafana
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_USER
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: admin-user
              name: grafana
        - name: GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_PASSWORD
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: admin-password
              name: grafana
        image: grafana/grafana:9.4.1
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        livenessProbe:
          failureThreshold: 10
          httpGet:
            path: /api/health
            port: 3000
          initialDelaySeconds: 60
          timeoutSeconds: 30
        name: grafana
        ports:
        - containerPort: 3000
          name: grafana
          protocol: TCP
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /api/health
            port: 3000
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 2000m
            memory: 4Gi
          requests:
            cpu: 500m
            memory: 1Gi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /etc/grafana/grafana.ini
          name: config
          subPath: grafana.ini
        - mountPath: /etc/grafana/provisioning/datasources/datasources.yaml
          name: datasources
          subPath: datasources.yaml
        - mountPath: /etc/grafana/provisioning/dashboards/dashboardproviders.yaml
          name: dashboards
          subPath: dashboardproviders.yaml
      securityContext:
        fsGroup: 472
        runAsUser: 472
      volumes:
      - configMap:
          name: grafana
        name: config
      - configMap:
          name: datasources
        name: datasources
      - configMap:
          name: dashboards
        name: dashboards

##### FILE: 6-deployment9.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/nginx:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: nginx
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: nginx
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: nginx
    spec:
      affinity:
        nodeAffinity:
          preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution:
          - preference:
              matchExpressions:
              - key: disktype
                operator: In
                values:
                - ssd
            weight: 1
          - preference:
              matchExpressions:
              - key: price
                operator: In
                values:
                - spot
            weight: 50
      containers:
      - image: nginx:1.14.2
        name: nginx
        ports:
        - containerPort: 80
        resources:
          requests:
            cpu: "1"
            memory: 2Gi

---

apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  name: myapp
  namespace: default
spec:
  containers:
  - image: aputra/myapp-182:0.1.0
    livenessProbe:
      httpGet:
        path: /status
        port: http
      initialDelaySeconds: 5
      periodSeconds: 3
    name: myapp
    ports:
    - containerPort: 8080
      name: http
    readinessProbe:
      httpGet:
        path: /status
        port: http
      initialDelaySeconds: 5
      periodSeconds: 3

##### FILE: 6-pod-configmap-env.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Pod/busybox:
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  name: busybox
  namespace: default
spec:
  containers:
  - args:
    - -c
    - sleep 600
    command:
    - /bin/sh
    env:
    - name: CHANNELNAME
      valueFrom:
        configMapKeyRef:
          key: channel.name
          name: demo-configmap
    - name: CHANNELOWNER
      valueFrom:
        configMapKeyRef:
          key: channel.owner
          name: demo-configmap
    image: busybox
    name: busybox

---

##### FILE: 6-pod-configmap-mysql-volume.yaml #####

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Pod/busybox:
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  name: busybox
  namespace: default
spec:
  containers:
  - args:
    - -c
    - sleep 600
    command:
    - /bin/sh
    image: busybox
    name: busybox
    volumeMounts:
    - mountPath: /mydata
      name: mysql-config
  volumes:
  - configMap:
      items:
      - key: my.cnf
        path: my.cnf
      name: mysql-demo-config
    name: mysql-config

---

apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: service-a
  namespace: service-a
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: service-a
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: service-a
    spec:
      containers:
      - image: aputra/myapp-175:v1
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: service-a
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8080
          name: http
        startupProbe:
          initialDelaySeconds: 20
          periodSeconds: 5
          tcpSocket:
            port: http
      serviceAccountName: service-a

---

##### FILE: 6-startup-liveness-mixed.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Pod/startup-mixed:
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  annotations:
    cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
  labels:
    app: startup-mixed
  name: startup-mixed
  namespace: default
spec:
  containers:
  - image: nginx
    livenessProbe:
      httpGet:
        path: /healthy.html
        port: 80
      initialDelaySeconds: 5
      periodSeconds: 5
    name: cont-main
    startupProbe:
      exec:
        command:
        - cat
        - /usr/share/nginx/html/healthy.html
      failureThreshold: 10
      periodSeconds: 5
    volumeMounts:
    - mountPath: /usr/share/nginx/html
      name: data
  - args:
    - while true; do sleep 20; echo 'WORKING' > /check/healthy.html; sleep 60; done
    command:
    - /bin/sh
    - -c
    image: alpine
    name: cont-sidecar-postpone
    volumeMounts:
    - mountPath: /check
      name: data
  - args:
    - while true; do sleep 60; rm /check/healthy.html; sleep 20; done
    command:
    - /bin/sh
    - -c
    image: alpine
    name: cont-sidecar-break
    volumeMounts:
    - mountPath: /check
      name: data
  initContainers:
  - args:
    - echo '(Almost) Always Ready to Serve ;)' > /data/index.html
    command:
    - /bin/sh
    - -c
    image: alpine
    name: init-data
    volumeMounts:
    - mountPath: /data
      name: data
  volumes:
  - emptyDir: {}
    name: data

---


Mutation:

##### FILE: 6-usr-mgmt-deployment.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/usermgmt-webapp:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: usermgmt-webapp
  name: usermgmt-webapp
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: usermgmt-webapp
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: usermgmt-webapp
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: DB_HOSTNAME
          value: mysql
        - name: DB_PORT
          value: "3306"
        - name: DB_NAME
          value: webappdb
        - name: DB_USERNAME
          value: root
        - name: DB_PASSWORD
          value: dbpassword11
        image: stacksimplify/kube-usermgmt-webapp:1.0.0-MySQLDB
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: usermgmt-webapp
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8080
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - sh
        - -c
        - echo -e "Checking for the availability of MySQL Server deployment"; while
          ! nc -z mysql 3306; do sleep 1; printf "-"; done; echo -e "  >> MySQL DB
          Server has started";
        image: busybox:1.31
        name: init-db

---

##### FILE: 6-volumenes_3.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/ConfigMap/configuraciones:
apiVersion: v1
data:
  dato1: valor1
  dato2: valor2
  nginx.conf: "user                    nginx;   # Usuario con el que se crean los
    subprocesos . P ej. Workers\nworker_processes        2;       # Numero de workers.
    Depende de las CPUs disponibles\nerror_log  /var/log/nginx/error.log warn;   #
    Ubicacin fichero de log de errores . Con el nivel de severidad\npid        /var/run/nginx.pid;
    \             # Ubicacin fichero que contiene el PID del master de nginx\n\nevents
    {\n    worker_connections  1024;              # Nmero de hilos /Conexiones simultaneas
    atendibles por UN worker\n}\n\n## Parte de la configuracin que alude al protocolo
    http\n\nhttp {\n    include       /etc/nginx/mime.types;    # Tipos de archivos
    (asociados a extensiones) que nginx auto-reconoce\n    default_type  application/octet-stream;
    # Si no encuentra un tipo de datos en el fichero anterior, pon este. BINARIOS\n
    \   log_format  main  '$remote_addr - $remote_user [$time_local] \"$request\"
    '\n                      '$status $body_bytes_sent \"$http_referer\" '\n                      '\"$http_user_agent\"
    \"$http_x_forwarded_for\"';\n                # LISTADO DE VARIABLES EN NGINX:
    http://nginx.org/en/docs/varindex.html\n                    # En este caso, al
    formato, le denominamos \"main\"... es un nombre con el que referirnos a l.\n\n
    \   access_log  /var/log/nginx/access.log  main;    # Ubicacion de un archivo
    donde se genere un log de accesos / Peticiones HTTP\n    sendfile        on;                             #
    Cmo nginx lee los ficheros a la hora de mandarlos al cliente.\n                                        #
    Con sendfile off => POR DEFECTO\n                                                #
    Nginx lee los ficheros a un buffer en RAM y desde ese buffer se van mandando al
    cliente\n                                        # Con sendfile on => NO ES POR
    DEFECTO\n                                                # Nginx lee los ficheros
    y segn va leyendo lo va mandando al cliente, sin cargarlo a un buffer propio
    en RAM\n                                                    # ESTO VA GUAY EN
    LINUX. En otros SO..... bufffff\n    #tcp_nopush     on;\n    keepalive_timeout
    \ 65;              # Tiempo que se va a mantener abierta la conexin sin notificaciones
    del cliente\n    #gzip  on;\n    upstream app1 {\n#        least_conn;\n        server
    ip-172-31-15-80:8082 weight=10;\n        server ip-172-31-15-80:8083 weight=1;\n
    \   }\n\n    # Esto sera un VIRTUAL HOST\n    server {\n        listen  80;                 \n
    \       server_name  localhost;     # El DNS a travs del que se pueden recibir
    las peticiones adicionalmente\n        root /frontal;              # La ruta (lo
    que hay detrs del puerto en la URL) buscala en una carpeta de mi Sistema de Archivos\n
    \           # Hay algn contenido esttico que yo vaya a servir en ALGUN escenario
    RARO?\n                # Que pasa si hay un error\n            \n        # Configurar
    una ruta para acceder al sitio1 (este est en otro nginx)\n        location =
    /sitio1 {\n            return 302 /sitio1/;\n        }\n\n        location /sitio1/
    {\n#            rewrite      /sitio1/carpeta/pagina.html     /carpeta/pagina.html
    \     break;\n#            rewrite      /sitio1/imagenes/imagen.jpg     /imagenes/imagen.jpg
    \     break;\n#            rewrite      ^/sitio1(/.*)$                  $1                        break;\n\n
    \           proxy_buffering off;\n            proxy_pass http://ip-172-31-15-80:8081/;
    # OJO CON LA BARRA... ME ESTA HACIENDO UN REWRITE. EL DE ARRIBA\n        }\n        #
    Configurar una ruta para acceder al app1 (este est en otro nginx)\n        location
    /app1/ {\n            proxy_buffering on;\n            proxy_buffers 10 10k;\n
    \           proxy_pass http://app1/;\n        }\n    }\n    \n}                       #
    RUTA (location)\n# www.guardiacivil.es     /sitio1 >>>>> sitio1\n# www.guardiacivil.es
    \    /app1 >>>>> APP1 (balanceo)\n"
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: configuraciones
  namespace: default

---

##### FILE: 6-volumenes_4.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Pod/pod-volumenes:
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  annotations:
    cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
  name: pod-volumenes
  namespace: default
spec:
  containers:
  - command:
    - sleep
    - "3600"
    image: ubuntu:latest
    name: contenedor1
    volumeMounts:
    - mountPath: /compartido
      name: volumen-compartido
    - mountPath: /super-rapido
      name: volumen-compartido-super-rapido
    - mountPath: /configuracion
      name: configuracion
    - mountPath: /otras-configuraciones
      name: configuracion2
    - mountPath: /procesos
      name: procesos
    - mountPath: /datosPersistentes
      name: persistente-nfs
    - mountPath: /datosPersistentes2
      name: persistente-2
  - command:
    - sleep
    - "3600"
    image: ubuntu:latest
    name: contenedor2
    volumeMounts:
    - mountPath: /otra-ruta
      name: volumen-compartido
    - mountPath: /super-rapido
      name: volumen-compartido-super-rapido
  initContainers:
  - command:
    - echo
    - hola
    image: ubuntu:latest
    name: contenedor-init-1
  - command:
    - git
    - clone
    - https://github.com/IvanciniGT/cursoNginX
    - /descargas
    image: bitnami/git
    name: contenedor-init-2
    volumeMounts:
    - mountPath: /descargas
      name: configuracion2
  volumes:
  - emptyDir: {}
    name: volumen-compartido
  - emptyDir:
      medium: Memory
    name: volumen-compartido-super-rapido
  - configMap:
      name: configuraciones
    name: configuracion
  - emptyDir:
      medium: Memory
    name: configuracion2
  - hostPath:
      path: /proc
      type: Directory
    name: procesos
  - name: persistente-nfs
    nfs:
      path: /home/ubuntu/environment/volumenes/nfs/contenedor1
      server: 172.31.11.161
  - name: persistente-2
    persistentVolumeClaim:
      claimName: mi-peticion-de-volumen-1

---

metadata:
  name: vote
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: vote
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: vote
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: OPTION_A
          value: Cats
        - name: OPTION_B
          value: Dogs
        - name: REDIS
          value: redis:6379
        image: dockersamples/examplevotingapp_vote:before
        name: vote
        ports:
        - containerPort: 80
          name: vote

##### FILE: 7.2-data_tier_1.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/data-tier:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: microservices
    tier: data
  name: data-tier
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      tier: data
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: microservices
        tier: data
    spec:
      containers:
      - image: redis:latest
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        livenessProbe:
          initialDelaySeconds: 15
          tcpSocket:
            port: redis
        name: redis
        ports:
        - containerPort: 6379
          name: redis
        readinessProbe:
          exec:
            command:
            - redis-cli
            - ping
          initialDelaySeconds: 5

---

##### FILE: 7.3-app_tier_1.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/app-tier:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: microservices
    tier: app
  name: app-tier
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      tier: app
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: microservices
        tier: app
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: REDIS_URL
          value: redis://$(DATA_TIER_SERVICE_HOST):$(DATA_TIER_SERVICE_PORT_REDIS)
        - name: DEBUG
          value: express:*
        image: lrakai/microservices:server-v1
        livenessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /probe/liveness
            port: server
          initialDelaySeconds: 5
        name: server
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8080
          name: server
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /probe/readiness
            port: server
          initialDelaySeconds: 3

---

##### FILE: 7_wordpress_deploy.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/wordpress:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: wordpress
  name: wordpress
  namespace: default
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: wordpress
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: wordpress
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: WORDPRESS_DB_HOST
          value: mysql-service
        - name: WORDPRESS_DB_PASSWORD
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: password
              name: mysql
        image: wordpress:4.8-apache
        name: wordpress
        ports:
        - containerPort: 80
          name: wordpress
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /var/www/html
          name: wordpress-persistent-storage
      volumes:
      - name: wordpress-persistent-storage
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: wordpress-pvc

---

##### FILE: 7_wordpress_deploy1.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/wordpress:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: wordpress
  name: wordpress
  namespace: default
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: wordpress
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: wordpress
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: WORDPRESS_DB_HOST
          value: mysql-service
        - name: WORDPRESS_DB_PASSWORD
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: password
              name: mysql
        image: wordpress:4.8-apache
        name: wordpress
        ports:
        - containerPort: 80
          name: wordpress
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /var/www/html
          name: wordpress-persistent-storage
      volumes:
      - name: wordpress-persistent-storage
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: wordpress-pvc

---

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to keel/Ingress/sites:
apiVersion: networking.k8s.io/v1
kind: Ingress
metadata:
  annotations:
    kubernetes.io/ingress.class: nginx
  name: sites
  namespace: keel
spec:
  rules:
  - host: keeladmin.simple-blog.strangled.net
    http:
      paths:
      - backend:
          service:
            name: keel
            port:
              number: 9300
        path: /
        pathType: Prefix

##### FILE: 70-validatingwebhookconfiguration.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/ValidatingWebhookConfiguration/pod-security-webhook.kubernetes.io:
apiVersion: admissionregistration.k8s.io/v1
kind: ValidatingWebhookConfiguration
metadata:
  name: pod-security-webhook.kubernetes.io
  namespace: default
webhooks:
- admissionReviewVersions:
  - v1
  clientConfig:
    caBundle: ""
    service:
      name: webhook
      namespace: pod-security-webhook
  failurePolicy: Fail
  name: pod-security-webhook.kubernetes.io
  namespaceSelector:
    matchExpressions:
    - key: kubernetes.io/metadata.name
      operator: NotIn
      values:
      - pod-security-webhook
  rules:
  - apiGroups:
    - ""
    apiVersions:
    - v1
    operations:
    - CREATE
    - UPDATE
    resources:
    - namespaces
    - pods
    - pods/ephemeralcontainers
  sideEffects: None
  timeoutSeconds: 5
- admissionReviewVersions:
  - v1
  clientConfig:
    caBundle: ""
    service:
      name: webhook
      namespace: pod-security-webhook
  failurePolicy: Ignore
  name: advisory.pod-security-webhook.kubernetes.io
  namespaceSelector:
    matchExpressions:
    - key: kubernetes.io/metadata.name
      operator: NotIn
      values:
      - pod-security-webhook
  rules:
  - apiGroups:
    - ""
    apiVersions:
    - v1
    operations:
    - CREATE
    - UPDATE
    resources:
    - podtemplates
    - replicationcontrollers
  - apiGroups:
    - apps
    apiVersions:
    - v1
    operations:
    - CREATE
    - UPDATE
    resources:
    - daemonsets
    - deployments
    - replicasets
    - statefulsets
  - apiGroups:
    - batch
    apiVersions:
    - v1
    operations:
    - CREATE
    - UPDATE
    resources:
    - cronjobs
    - jobs
  sideEffects: None
  timeoutSeconds: 5

---

apiVersion: admissionregistration.k8s.io/v1
kind: ValidatingWebhookConfiguration
metadata:
  name: pod-security-webhook.kubernetes.io
  namespace: default
webhooks:
- admissionReviewVersions:
  - v1
  clientConfig:
    caBundle: ""
    service:
      name: webhook
      namespace: pod-security-webhook
  failurePolicy: Fail
  name: pod-security-webhook.kubernetes.io
  namespaceSelector:
    matchExpressions:
    - key: kubernetes.io/metadata.name
      operator: NotIn
      values:
      - pod-security-webhook
  rules:
  - apiGroups:
    - ""
    apiVersions:

    - CREATE
    - UPDATE

    - namespaces
    - pods
    - pods/ephemeralcontainers

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/ReplicaSet/nginx:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: ReplicaSet
metadata:
  name: nginx
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: nginx
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: nginx
      name: nginx
    spec:
      containers:
      - image: registry.cn-beijing.aliyuncs.com/qingfeng666/nginx:latest
        name: nginx
        ports:
        - containerPort: 80

##### FILE: 7-3-statefulset_4.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/StatefulSet/web:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  name: web
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: nginx
  serviceName: nginx
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: nginx
    spec:
      containers:
      - image: registry.cn-beijing.aliyuncs.com/qingfeng666/nginx:latest
        name: nginx
        ports:
        - containerPort: 80
          name: web
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /usr/share/nginx/html
          name: www
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 10
  volumeClaimTemplates:
  - metadata:
      name: www
    spec:
      accessModes:
      - ReadWriteOnce
      resources:
        requests:
          storage: 1Gi
      storageClassName: my-storage-class

---

1 - autogen-validate-image-tag validation failure: validation error: Using a mutable image tag e.g. 'latest' is not allowed. rule autogen-validate-image-tag failed at path /image/

##### FILE: 7-4-daemonset.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/DaemonSet/fluentd-elasticsearch:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: DaemonSet
metadata:
  labels:
    k8s-app: fluentd-logging
  name: fluentd-elasticsearch
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      name: fluentd-elasticsearch
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
      labels:
        name: fluentd-elasticsearch
    spec:
      containers:
      - image: registry.cn-beijing.aliyuncs.com/qingfeng666/fluentd:v2.5.2
        name: fluentd-elasticsearch
        resources:
          limits:
            memory: 200Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 200Mi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /var/log
          name: varlog
        - mountPath: /var/lib/docker/containers
          name: varlibdockercontainers
          readOnly: true
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 30
      tolerations:
      - effect: NoSchedule
        key: node-role.kubernetes.io/master
      volumes:
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/log
        name: varlog
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/lib/docker/containers
        name: varlibdockercontainers

---

##### FILE: 7-arbiter-statefulset.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to database/StatefulSet/mongodb-arbiter:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  name: mongodb-arbiter
  namespace: database
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app.kubernetes.io/component: arbiter
      app.kubernetes.io/name: mongodb
  serviceName: mongodb-arbiter-headless
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app.kubernetes.io/component: arbiter
        app.kubernetes.io/name: mongodb
    spec:
      affinity:
        podAntiAffinity:
          preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution:
          - podAffinityTerm:
              labelSelector:
                matchLabels:
                  app.kubernetes.io/name: mongodb
              namespaces:
              - database
              topologyKey: kubernetes.io/hostname
            weight: 1
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: BITNAMI_DEBUG
          value: "false"
        - name: MY_POD_NAME
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.name
        - name: MY_POD_NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        - name: MONGODB_REPLICA_SET_NAME
          value: rs0
        - name: K8S_SERVICE_NAME
          value: mongodb-arbiter-headless
        - name: MONGODB_REPLICA_SET_MODE
          value: arbiter
        - name: MONGODB_INITIAL_PRIMARY_HOST
          value: mongodb-0.mongodb-headless.$(MY_POD_NAMESPACE).svc.cluster.local
        - name: MONGODB_ADVERTISED_HOSTNAME
          value: $(MY_POD_NAME).$(K8S_SERVICE_NAME).$(MY_POD_NAMESPACE).svc.cluster.local
        - name: MONGODB_INITIAL_PRIMARY_ROOT_PASSWORD
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: mongodb-root-password
              name: mongodb
        - name: MONGODB_REPLICA_SET_KEY
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: mongodb-replica-set-key
              name: mongodb
        - name: ALLOW_EMPTY_PASSWORD
          value: "no"
        image: docker.io/bitnami/mongodb:4.4.4
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        livenessProbe:
          failureThreshold: 6
          initialDelaySeconds: 30
          periodSeconds: 10
          successThreshold: 1
          tcpSocket:
            port: mongodb
          timeoutSeconds: 5
        name: mongodb-arbiter
        ports:
        - containerPort: 27017
          name: mongodb
        readinessProbe:
          failureThreshold: 6
          initialDelaySeconds: 5
          periodSeconds: 10
          successThreshold: 1
          tcpSocket:
            port: mongodb
          timeoutSeconds: 5
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 200m
            memory: 256Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 128Mi
        securityContext:
          runAsUser: 1001
      initContainers: null
      securityContext:
        fsGroup: 1001
        sysctls: []
      serviceAccountName: mongodb

---


Mutation:

                index  index.html index.htm;

##### FILE: 7-cronjob-startingDeadlineSeconds.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/CronJob/hello-startingdeadlineseconds:
apiVersion: batch/v1
kind: CronJob
metadata:
  name: hello-startingdeadlineseconds
  namespace: default
spec:
  concurrencyPolicy: Forbid
  jobTemplate:
    spec:
      backoffLimit: 1
      template:
        spec:
          containers:
          - args:
            - /bin/sh
            - -c
            - date; echo "Hello World!"; sleep 8000
            image: busybox
            name: hello-startingdeadlineseconds
          restartPolicy: Never
  schedule: '*/1 * * * *'
  startingDeadlineSeconds: 8200

---

##### FILE: 7-deployment.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to storage/Deployment/nfs-client-provisioner:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: nfs-client-provisioner
  namespace: storage
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: nfs-client-provisioner
  strategy:
    type: Recreate
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: nfs-client-provisioner
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: PROVISIONER_NAME
          value: efs-storage
        - name: NFS_SERVER
          value: 192.168.33.21
        - name: NFS_PATH
          value: /
        image: quay.io/external_storage/nfs-client-provisioner:latest
        name: nfs-client-provisioner
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /persistentvolumes
          name: nfs-client-root
      serviceAccountName: nfs-client-provisioner
      volumes:
      - name: nfs-client-root
        nfs:
          path: /
          server: 192.168.33.21

---

##### FILE: 7-job.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/CronJob/hello-cluster:
apiVersion: batch/v1
kind: CronJob
metadata:
  name: hello-cluster
  namespace: default
spec:
  jobTemplate:
    spec:
      template:
        spec:
          containers:
          - command:
            - /bin/sh
            - -c
            - date; echo Hello from the Kubernetes cluster
            image: busybox:1.28
            imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
            name: hello-cluster
          restartPolicy: OnFailure
  schedule: '* * * * *'

---

##### FILE: 7-service-b-istio.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/service-b-istio:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: service-b-istio
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: service-b-istio
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        sidecar.istio.io/proxyCPU: 500m
        sidecar.istio.io/proxyCPULimit: 500m
        sidecar.istio.io/proxyMemory: 256Mi
        sidecar.istio.io/proxyMemoryLimit: 256Mi
      labels:
        app: service-b-istio
        sidecar.istio.io/inject: "true"
    spec:
      containers:
      - image: aputra/service-b-172:v4
        name: service-b-istio
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8181
          name: http
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: "1"
            memory: 2Gi
          requests:
            cpu: "1"
            memory: 2Gi
      nodeSelector:
        service: istio
      tolerations:
      - effect: NoSchedule
        key: service
        operator: Equal
        value: istio

---


Mutation:
Mutation has been applied successfully.
skipped mutate policy add-safe-to-evict -> resource default/Deployment/service-b-istio

skipped mutate policy add-safe-to-evict -> resource default/Deployment/service-b-istio
policy disallow-default-namespace -> resource default/Deployment/service-b-istio failed:
1 - validate-podcontroller-namespace validation error: Using 'default' namespace is not allowed for pod controllers. rule validate-podcontroller-namespace failed at path /metadata/namespace/

policy drop-all-capabilities -> resource default/Deployment/service-b-istio failed:
1 - autogen-require-drop-all validation failure: Containers must drop `ALL` capabilities.

policy drop-cap-net-raw -> resource default/Deployment/service-b-istio failed:
1 - autogen-require-drop-cap-net-raw validation failure: Containers must drop the `CAP_NET_RAW` capability.

policy require-labels -> resource default/Deployment/service-b-istio failed:
1 - autogen-check-for-labels validation error: The label `app.kubernetes.io/name` is required. rule autogen-check-for-labels failed at path /spec/template/metadata/labels/app.kubernetes.io/name/

policy require-pod-probes -> resource default/Deployment/service-b-istio failed:
1 - autogen-validate-probes validation failure: Liveness, readiness, or startup probes are required for all containers.

policy require-ro-rootfs -> resource default/Deployment/service-b-istio failed:
1 - autogen-validate-readOnlyRootFilesystem validation error: Root filesystem must be read-only. rule autogen-validate-readOnlyRootFilesystem failed at path /spec/template/spec/containers/0/securityContext/

policy restrict-image-registries -> resource default/Deployment/service-b-istio failed:
1 - autogen-validate-registries validation error: Unknown image registry. rule autogen-validate-registries failed at path /spec/template/spec/containers/0/image/

      app: service-b-istio
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        sidecar.istio.io/proxyCPU: 500m
        sidecar.istio.io/proxyCPULimit: 500m
        sidecar.istio.io/proxyMemory: 256Mi
        sidecar.istio.io/proxyMemoryLimit: 256Mi

          name: http
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: "1"
            memory: 2Gi
          requests:
            cpu: "1"
            memory: 2Gi

##### FILE: 8.1-app_tier_1.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/app-tier:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: microservices
    tier: app
  name: app-tier
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      tier: app
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: microservices
        tier: app
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: REDIS_URL
          value: redis://$(DATA_TIER_SERVICE_HOST):$(DATA_TIER_SERVICE_PORT_REDIS)
        - name: DEBUG
          value: express:*
        image: lrakai/microservices:server-v1
        livenessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /probe/liveness
            port: server
          initialDelaySeconds: 5
        name: server
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8080
          name: server
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /probe/readiness
            port: server
          initialDelaySeconds: 3
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - npm
        - run-script
        - await-redis
        env:
        - name: REDIS_URL
          value: redis://$(DATA_TIER_SERVICE_HOST):$(DATA_TIER_SERVICE_PORT_REDIS)
        image: lrakai/microservices:server-v1
        name: await-redis

---

##### FILE: 8-1-metrics-server-init_7.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/Deployment/metrics-server:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    k8s-app: metrics-server
  name: metrics-server
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: metrics-server
  strategy:
    rollingUpdate:
      maxUnavailable: 0
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
      labels:
        k8s-app: metrics-server
    spec:
      containers:
      - args:
        - --cert-dir=/tmp
        - --secure-port=10250
        - --kubelet-preferred-address-types=InternalIP,ExternalIP,Hostname
        - --kubelet-use-node-status-port
        - --metric-resolution=15s
        - --kubelet-insecure-tls
        image: registry.k8s.io/metrics-server/metrics-server:v0.7.1
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        livenessProbe:
          failureThreshold: 3
          httpGet:
            path: /livez
            port: https
            scheme: HTTPS
          periodSeconds: 10
        name: metrics-server
        ports:
        - containerPort: 10250
          name: https
          protocol: TCP
        readinessProbe:
          failureThreshold: 3
          httpGet:
            path: /readyz
            port: https
            scheme: HTTPS
          initialDelaySeconds: 20
          periodSeconds: 10
        resources:
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 200Mi
        securityContext:
          allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
          capabilities:
            drop:
            - ALL
          readOnlyRootFilesystem: true
          runAsNonRoot: true
          runAsUser: 1000
          seccompProfile:
            type: RuntimeDefault
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /tmp
          name: tmp-dir
      nodeSelector:
        kubernetes.io/os: linux
      priorityClassName: system-cluster-critical
      serviceAccountName: metrics-server
      volumes:
      - emptyDir: {}
        name: tmp-dir

---

##### FILE: 8-6-allInOne.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/nfs-client-provisioner:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: nfs-client-provisioner
  name: nfs-client-provisioner
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: nfs-client-provisioner
  strategy:
    type: Recreate
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: nfs-client-provisioner
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: PROVISIONER_NAME
          value: qgg-nfs-storage
        - name: NFS_SERVER
          value: master
        - name: NFS_PATH
          value: /nfsdata
        image: registry.cn-beijing.aliyuncs.com/qingfeng666/nfs-client-provisioner:v3.1.0
        name: nfs-client-provisioner
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /persistentvolumes
          name: nfs-client-root
      serviceAccountName: nfs-client-provisioner
      volumes:
      - name: nfs-client-root
        nfs:
          path: /nfsdata
          server: master

---

##### FILE: 8-6-nfs-client-provisioner.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/nfs-client-provisioner:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: nfs-client-provisioner
  name: nfs-client-provisioner
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: nfs-client-provisioner
  strategy:
    type: Recreate
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: nfs-client-provisioner
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: PROVISIONER_NAME
          value: qgg-nfs-storage
        - name: NFS_SERVER
          value: master
        - name: NFS_PATH
          value: /nfsdata
        image: registry.cn-beijing.aliyuncs.com/qingfeng666/nfs-client-provisioner:v3.1.0
        name: nfs-client-provisioner
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /persistentvolumes
          name: nfs-client-root
      serviceAccountName: nfs-client-provisioner
      volumes:
      - name: nfs-client-root
        nfs:
          path: /nfsdata
          server: master

---

##### FILE: 8b_parca_1.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to core/Deployment/parca:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: parca
  name: parca
  namespace: core
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: parca
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
      labels:
        app: parca
    spec:
      containers:
      - args:
        - /parca
        - --http-address=:7070
        - --config-path=/etc/parca/parca.yaml
        - --log-level=info
        - --cors-allowed-origins=*
        - --debuginfod-upstream-servers=https://debuginfod.systemtap.org
        - --debuginfod-http-request-timeout=5m
        image: ghcr.io/parca-dev/parca:v0.20.0
        name: parca
        ports:
        - containerPort: 7070
          name: parca-web-ins
        terminationMessagePolicy: FallbackToLogsOnError
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /etc/parca
          name: config
        - mountPath: /var/lib/parca
          name: storage
      nodeSelector:
        role: core
      securityContext:
        fsGroup: 65534
        runAsUser: 65534
      serviceAccountName: parca
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 120
      volumes:
      - configMap:
          name: parca
        name: config
      - emptyDir: {}
        name: storage

---

##### FILE: 8-cronjob-without-startingDeadlineSeconds.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/CronJob/hello-without-startingdeadlineseconds:
apiVersion: batch/v1
kind: CronJob
metadata:
  name: hello-without-startingdeadlineseconds
  namespace: default
spec:
  concurrencyPolicy: Forbid
  jobTemplate:
    spec:
      backoffLimit: 1
      template:
        spec:
          containers:
          - args:
            - /bin/sh
            - -c
            - date; echo "Hello World!"; sleep 7000
            image: busybox
            name: hello-without-startingdeadlineseconds
          restartPolicy: Never
  schedule: '*/1 * * * *'

---

##### FILE: 8-deployment.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to demo-app/Deployment/nginx-deployment:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: nginx-deployment
  namespace: demo-app
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: nginx
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: nginx
    spec:
      containers:
      - image: nginx:latest
        name: nginx
        ports:
        - containerPort: 80
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /etc/nginx/tls
          name: tls-certs
          readOnly: true
        - mountPath: /etc/nginx/nginx.conf
          name: config-volume
          subPath: nginx.conf
      serviceAccountName: demo-sa
      volumes:
      - name: tls-certs
        secret:
          secretName: demo-tls
      - configMap:
          name: nginx-config
        name: config-volume

---

##### FILE: 8-nginx-rolling-update.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/nginx-deploy:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    run: nginx
  name: nginx-deploy
  namespace: default
spec:
  minReadySeconds: 5
  replicas: 4
  revisionHistoryLimit: 10
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      run: nginx
  strategy:
    rollingUpdate:
      maxSurge: 0
      maxUnavailable: 1
    type: RollingUpdate
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        run: nginx
    spec:
      containers:
      - image: nginx:1.14
        name: nginx

---

##### FILE: 8-tethys.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to tethys/Deployment/tethys-github:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    name: tethys-github
  name: tethys-github
  namespace: tethys
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: tethys-github
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: tethys-github
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: K8S_HOST_IP
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: status.hostIP
        - name: K8S_POD_IP
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: status.podIP
        - name: ALLOWED_HOSTS
          value: '"[localhost, 127.0.0.1, 62.10.56.139]"'
        - name: CLIENT_MAX_BODY_SIZE
          value: 75M
        - name: NGINX_PORT
          value: "80"
        - name: TETHYS_DB_HOST
          value: tethys-pg
        - name: TETHYS_DB_NAME
          value: tethys_platform
        - name: TETHYS_DB_USERNAME
          value: tethys_default
        - name: TETHYS_DB_PASSWORD
          value: pass
        - name: TETHYS_DB_SUPERUSER
          value: tethys_super
        - name: TETHYS_DB_SUPERUSER_PASS
          value: pass
        - name: TETHYS_PORT
          value: "8000"
        image: docker.io/gronka/tethyscore:latest
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: tethys-github
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8000

---

##### FILE: 9.2-pv_data_tier_3.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/data-tier:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: microservices
    tier: data
  name: data-tier
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      tier: data
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: microservices
        tier: data
    spec:
      containers:
      - image: redis:latest
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        livenessProbe:
          initialDelaySeconds: 15
          tcpSocket:
            port: redis
        name: redis
        ports:
        - containerPort: 6379
          name: redis
        readinessProbe:
          exec:
            command:
            - redis-cli
            - ping
          initialDelaySeconds: 5
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data
          name: data-tier-volume
      volumes:
      - name: data-tier-volume
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: data-tier-volume-claim

---

##### FILE: 9.3.2 pod-with-node-affinity.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Pod/pod-with-node-affinity:
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  name: pod-with-node-affinity
  namespace: default
spec:
  affinity:
    nodeAffinity:
      preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution:
      - preference:
          matchExpressions:
          - key: disk-type
            operator: In
            values:
            - ssd
        weight: 1
      requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution:
        nodeSelectorTerms:
        - matchExpressions:
          - key: kubernetes.io/arch
            operator: In
            values:
            - amd64
  containers:
  - image: nginx
    name: nginx

---


Mutation:

##### FILE: 9.3.2 pod-with-node-affinity-weight.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Pod/pod-with-node-affinity-weight:
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  name: pod-with-node-affinity-weight
  namespace: default
spec:
  affinity:
    nodeAffinity:
      preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution:
      - preference:
          matchExpressions:
          - key: zone
            operator: In
            values:
            - north
        weight: 1
      - preference:
          matchExpressions:
          - key: disk-type
            operator: In
            values:
            - ssd
        weight: 50
  containers:
  - image: nginx
    name: nginx

---

##### FILE: 9.3-app_tier_1.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/app-tier:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: microservices
    tier: app
  name: app-tier
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      tier: app
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: microservices
        tier: app
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: REDIS_URL
          value: redis://$(DATA_TIER_SERVICE_HOST):$(DATA_TIER_SERVICE_PORT_REDIS)
        - name: DEBUG
          value: express:*
        image: lrakai/microservices:server-v1
        livenessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /probe/liveness
            port: server
          initialDelaySeconds: 5
        name: server
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8080
          name: server
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /probe/readiness
            port: server
          initialDelaySeconds: 3
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - npm
        - run-script
        - await-redis
        env:
        - name: REDIS_URL
          value: redis://$(DATA_TIER_SERVICE_HOST):$(DATA_TIER_SERVICE_PORT_REDIS)
        image: lrakai/microservices:server-v1
        name: await-redis

---

##### FILE: 9_FileBeat_3.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/ConfigMap/filebeat-config:
apiVersion: v1
data:
  filebeat.yml: |-
    filebeat.config:
      prospectors:
        # Mounted `filebeat-prospectors` configmap:
        path: ${path.config}/prospectors.d/*.yml
        # Reload prospectors configs as they change:
        reload.enabled: false
      modules:
        path: ${path.config}/modules.d/*.yml
        # Reload module configs as they change:
        reload.enabled: false
    output.logstash:
      hosts: ['logstash-service:5044']
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  labels:
    k8s-app: filebeat
  name: filebeat-config
  namespace: kube-system

---

      - "*"

##### FILE: 9_FileBeat_5.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/DaemonSet/filebeat:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: DaemonSet
metadata:
  labels:
    k8s-app: filebeat
  name: filebeat
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: filebeat
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
      labels:
        k8s-app: filebeat
    spec:
      containers:
      - args:
        - -c
        - /etc/filebeat.yml
        - -e
        image: docker.elastic.co/beats/filebeat:6.8.4
        name: filebeat
        securityContext:
          runAsUser: 0
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /etc/filebeat.yml
          name: config
          readOnly: true
          subPath: filebeat.yml
        - mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/prospectors.d
          name: prospectors
          readOnly: true
        - mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/data
          name: data
        - mountPath: /var/lib/docker/containers
          name: varlibdockercontainers
          readOnly: true
      serviceAccountName: filebeat
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 30
      volumes:
      - configMap:
          defaultMode: 384
          name: filebeat-config
        name: config
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/lib/docker/containers
        name: varlibdockercontainers
      - configMap:
          defaultMode: 384
          name: filebeat-prospectors
        name: prospectors
      - emptyDir: {}
        name: data

---


Mutation:

##### FILE: 90_FluentBit_test.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/ConfigMap/fluent-bit-config:
apiVersion: v1
data:
  fluent-bit.conf: "[SERVICE]\n    Flush        1\n    Log_Level    info\n\n[INPUT]\n
    \   Name tail\n    Path /var/log/containers/*.log\n    Parser docker\n    Tag
    kube.*\n    Mem_Buf_Limit 5MB\n    Skip_Long_Lines On\n\n[FILTER]\n    Name kubernetes\n
    \   Match kube.*\n    Merge_Log On\n    Merge_Log_Trim On\n    Labels On\n    Annotations
    Off\n    K8S-Logging.Parser On\n    K8S-Logging.Exclude On\n\n[FILTER]\n    Name
    grep\n    Match kube.*\n    Exclude $kubernetes['namespace_name'] kube-system\n
    \   Exclude $kubernetes['namespace_name'] kube-public\n    Exclude $kubernetes['namespace_name']
    kube-node-lease\n    Exclude $kubernetes['namespace_name'] ingress-nginx\n\n[FILTER]\n
    \   Name nest\n    Match kube.*\n    Operation lift\n    Nested_under kubernetes\n
    \   Add_prefix kubernetes_\n\n[FILTER]\n    Name modify\n    Match kube.*\n    Rename
    log content\n    Remove kubernetes_docker_id\n    Remove kubernetes_container_name\n
    \   Remove kubernetes_container_hash\n    Remove kubernetes_container_image\n\n[OUTPUT]\n
    \   Name            es\n    Match           kube.*\n    Host            elasticsearch-logging\n
    \   Port            9200\n    Generate_ID on\n    \n"
  parsers.conf: |
    [PARSER]
        Name        docker
        Format      json
        Time_Key    time
        Time_Format %!Y(MISSING)-%!m(MISSING)-%!d(MISSING)T%!H(MISSING):%!M(MISSING):%!S(MISSING).%!L(MISSING)
        Time_Keep   On
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  labels:
    k8s-app: fluent-bit
  name: fluent-bit-config
  namespace: default

---

##### FILE: 90-acl-conf.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to mailserver/ConfigMap/90-acl-conf:
apiVersion: v1
data:
  90-acl.conf: |
    ##
    ## Mailbox access control lists.
    ##

    # vfile backend reads ACLs from "dovecot-acl" file from mail directory.
    # You can also optionally give a global ACL directory path where ACLs are
    # applied to all users' mailboxes. The global ACL directory contains
    # one file for each mailbox, eg. INBOX or sub.mailbox. cache_secs parameter
    # specifies how many seconds to wait between stat()ing dovecot-acl file
    # to see if it changed.
    plugin {
      #acl = vfile:/etc/dovecot/global-acls:cache_secs=300
    }

    # To let users LIST mailboxes shared by other users, Dovecot needs a
    # shared mailbox dictionary. For example:
    plugin {
      #acl_shared_dict = file:/var/lib/dovecot/shared-mailboxes
    }
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: 90-acl-conf
  namespace: mailserver

---


Mutation:
Mutation has been applied successfully.
pass: 0, fail: 0, warn: 0, error: 0, skip: 0 

##### FILE: 90-plugin-conf.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to mailserver/ConfigMap/90-plugin-conf:
apiVersion: v1
data:
  90-plugin.conf: |
    ##
    ## Plugin settings
    ##

    # All wanted plugins must be listed in mail_plugins setting before any of the
    # settings take effect. See <doc/wiki/Plugins.txt> for list of plugins and
    # their configuration. Note that %!v(MISSING)ariable expansion is done for all values.

    plugin {
      #setting_name = value
    }
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: 90-plugin-conf
  namespace: mailserver

---

##### FILE: 90-quota-conf.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to mailserver/ConfigMap/90-quota-conf:
apiVersion: v1
data:
  90-quoata.conf: |
    ##
    ## Quota configuration.
    ##

    # Note that you also have to enable quota plugin in mail_plugins setting.
    # <doc/wiki/Quota.txt>

    ##
    ## Quota limits
    ##

    # Quota limits are set using "quota_rule" parameters. To get per-user quota
    # limits, you can set/override them by returning "quota_rule" extra field
    # from userdb. It's also possible to give mailbox-specific limits, for example
    # to give additional 100 MB when saving to Trash:

    plugin {
      #quota_rule = *:storage=1G
      #quota_rule2 = Trash:storage=+100M

      # LDA/LMTP allows saving the last mail to bring user from under quota to
      # over quota, if the quota doesn't grow too high. Default is to allow as
      # long as quota will stay under 10%!a(MISSING)bove the limit. Also allowed e.g. 10M.
      #quota_grace = 10%

      # Quota plugin can also limit the maximum accepted mail size.
      #quota_max_mail_size = 100M
    }

    ##
    ## Quota warnings
    ##

    # You can execute a given command when user exceeds a specified quota limit.
    # Each quota root has separate limits. Only the command for the first
    # exceeded limit is executed, so put the highest limit first.
    # The commands are executed via script service by connecting to the named
    # UNIX socket (quota-warning below).
    # Note that %!n(MISSING)eeds to be escaped as %, otherwise "%!"(MISSING) expands to empty.

    plugin {
      #quota_warning = storage=95% quota-warning 95 %!u(MISSING)
      #quota_warning2 = storage=80% quota-warning 80 %!u(MISSING)
    }

    # Example quota-warning service. The unix listener's permissions should be
    # set in a way that mail processes can connect to it. Below example assumes
    # that mail processes run as vmail user. If you use mode=0666, all system users
    # can generate quota warnings to anyone.
    #service quota-warning {
    #  executable = script /usr/local/bin/quota-warning.sh
    #  user = dovecot
    #  unix_listener quota-warning {
    #    user = vmail
    #  }
    #}

    ##
    ## Quota backends
    ##

    # Multiple backends are supported:
    #   dirsize: Find and sum all the files found from mail directory.
    #            Extremely SLOW with Maildir. It'll eat your CPU and disk I/O.
    #   dict: Keep quota stored in dictionary (eg. SQL)
    #   maildir: Maildir++ quota
    #   fs: Read-only support for filesystem quota

    plugin {
      #quota = dirsize:User quota
      #quota = maildir:User quota
      #quota = dict:User quota::proxy::quota
      #quota = fs:User quota
    }

    # Multiple quota roots are also possible, for example this gives each user
    # their own 100MB quota and one shared 1GB quota within the domain:
    plugin {
      #quota = dict:user::proxy::quota
      #quota2 = dict:domain:%!d(MISSING):proxy::quota_domain
      #quota_rule = *:storage=102400
      #quota2_rule = *:storage=1048576
    }
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: 90-quota-conf
  namespace: mailserver

---


Mutation:
Mutation has been applied successfully.
pass: 0, fail: 0, warn: 0, error: 0, skip: 0 

##### FILE: 90-sieve-extprograms-conf.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to mailserver/ConfigMap/90-sieve-extprograms-conf:
apiVersion: v1
data:
  90-sieve-extprograms.conf: |
    # Sieve Extprograms plugin configuration

    # Don't forget to add the sieve_extprograms plugin to the sieve_plugins setting.
    # Also enable the extensions you need (one or more of vnd.dovecot.pipe,
    # vnd.dovecot.filter and vnd.dovecot.execute) by adding these   to the
    # sieve_extensions or sieve_global_extensions settings. Restricting these
    # extensions to a global context using sieve_global_extensions is recommended.

    plugin {

      # The directory where the program sockets are located for the
      # vnd.dovecot.pipe, vnd.dovecot.filter and vnd.dovecot.execute extension
      # respectively. The name of each unix socket contained in that directory
      # directly maps to a program-name referenced from the Sieve script.
      #sieve_pipe_socket_dir = sieve-pipe
      #sieve_filter_socket_dir = sieve-filter
      #sieve_execute_socket_dir = sieve-execute

      # The directory where the scripts are located for direct execution by the
      # vnd.dovecot.pipe, vnd.dovecot.filter and vnd.dovecot.execute extension
      # respectively. The name of each script contained in that directory
      # directly maps to a program-name referenced from the Sieve script.
      #sieve_pipe_bin_dir = /usr/lib/dovecot/sieve-pipe
      #sieve_filter_bin_dir = /usr/lib/dovecot/sieve-filter
      #sieve_execute_bin_dir = /usr/lib/dovecot/sieve-execute
    }

    # An example program service called 'do-something' to pipe messages to
    #service do-something {
      # Define the executed script as parameter to the sieve service
      #executable = script /usr/lib/dovecot/sieve-pipe/do-something.sh

      # Use some unprivileged user for executing the program
      #user = dovenull

      # The unix socket located in the sieve_pipe_socket_dir (as defined in the
      # plugin {} section above)
      #unix_listener sieve-pipe/do-something {
        # LDA/LMTP must have access
      #  user = vmail
      #  mode = 0600
      #}
    #}
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: 90-sieve-extprograms-conf
  namespace: mailserver

---

##### FILE: 99-ingress_1.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to argo/Ingress/argo-ingress:
apiVersion: networking.k8s.io/v1
kind: Ingress
metadata:
  annotations:
    nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/force-ssl-redirect: "true"
    nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/ssl-passthrough: "true"
  name: argo-ingress
  namespace: argo
spec:
  ingressClassName: nginx
  rules:
  - host: argo.localhost
    http:
      paths:
      - backend:
          service:
            name: argo-server
            port:
              number: 2746
        path: /wf

##### FILE: 9-cronjob-timezone.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/CronJob/cronjob-timezone:
apiVersion: batch/v1
kind: CronJob
metadata:
  name: cronjob-timezone
  namespace: default
spec:
  concurrencyPolicy: Allow
  jobTemplate:
    spec:
      template:
        spec:
          containers:
          - args:
            - /bin/sh
            - -c
            - date; echo "Hello World!"; sleep 140
            image: busybox
            name: cronjob-timezone
          restartPolicy: OnFailure
  schedule: '*/1 * * * *'
  timeZone: Europe/Warsaw

---

apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  name: nginx-sts
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      run: nginx-sts-demo
  serviceName: nginx-headless
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        run: nginx-sts-demo
    spec:
      containers:
      - image: nginx
        name: nginx
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /var/www/
          name: www
  volumeClaimTemplates:
  - metadata:
      name: www
    spec:
      accessModes:
      - ReadWriteOnce
      resources:
        requests:
          storage: 100Mi
      storageClassName: manual

---

        run: nginx-sts-demo
    spec:
      containers:
      - image: nginx
        name: nginx
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /var/www/
          name: www
  volumeClaimTemplates:
  - metadata:
      name: www
    spec:
      accessModes:
      - ReadWriteOnce
      resources:
        requests:
          storage: 100Mi
      storageClassName: manual
